thread.title: Green, Ennis lead Heat to preseason win over Atlanta
thread.title_full: Green, Ennis lead Heat to preseason win over Atlanta

author: GEORGE HENRY, Associated Press
title: Green, Ennis lead Heat to preseason win over Atlanta
text: Close Image 1 of 4 Atlanta Hawks forward Mike Muscala (31) blocks the shot of Miami Heat guard Dwyane Wade (3) in the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015, in Atlanta. Atlanta Hawks forward Mike Muscala (31) blocks the shot of Miami Heat guard Dwyane Wade (3) in the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015, in Atlanta. Photo: Todd Kirkland, AP Image 2 of 4 Atlanta Hawks guard Kyle Korver (26) drives to the basket as forward Mike Muscala (31) blocks Miami Heat guard Josh Richardson (0) in the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game on Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015, in Atlanta. Atlanta Hawks guard Kyle Korver (26) drives to the basket as forward Mike Muscala (31) blocks Miami Heat guard Josh Richardson (0) in the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game on Sunday, Oct. 18, ... more Photo: Todd Kirkland, AP Image 3 of 4 Miami Heat guard Josh Richardson (0) is called for a foul against Atlanta Hawks forward Paul Millsap (4) in the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015, in Atlanta. Miami Heat guard Josh Richardson (0) is called for a foul against Atlanta Hawks forward Paul Millsap (4) in the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015, in Atlanta. Photo: Todd Kirkland, AP Image 4 of 4 Atlanta Hawks head coach Mike Budenholzer reacts in the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game against the Miami Heat, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015, in Atlanta. Atlanta Hawks head coach Mike Budenholzer reacts in the first half of a preseason NBA basketball game against the Miami Heat, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015, in Atlanta. Photo: Todd Kirkland, AP Green, Ennis lead Heat to preseason win over Atlanta 1 / 4 Back to Gallery ATLANTA (AP) â€” Gerald Green and James Ennis each scored 19 points and the Miami Heat beat the Atlanta Hawks 101-92 in a preseason game Sunday night. Chris Bosh had 14 points for Miami, which improved to 3-3 in preseason. Bosh and fellow starters Dwyane Wade and Luol Deng were held out in second half. Mike Scott finished with 19 points as Atlanta dropped to 4-1. HEAT: Center Hassan Whiteside was held out with a sore left ankle. Coach Erik Spoelstra said the injury isn't considered serious. Whiteside missed the first four preseason games with a strained right calf. ... The team listed "rehabilitative recovery" as the reason rookie forward Justise Winslow didn't play. ... F Udonis Haslem has stitches around both eyes and was held out. HAWKS: Coach Mike Budenholzer used his regular starting lineup of Kyle Korver , Jeff Teague , Al Horford , Kent Bazemore and Paul Millsap . All five began the third. UP NEXT: Miami hosts Washington on Wednesday. The Hawks host Memphis on Wednesday. Southeast Texas sports news
